support_training.pre_opening_assistance: The franchisor or its designee will designate the territory, provide access to scheduling software, an internet site for prospective customers, an e-mail account, and an intranet site. They will also provide specifications for equipment, inventory, and supplies, a list of approved suppliers, pre-opening and opening activities, and access to a proprietary project management start-up onboarding program. A copy of the Operations Manual will be made available electronically.

initial_training.duration_description: 20-29 hour initial training program, plus approximately 10 to 12 weeks of onboarding work and study prior to the initial business training program. The initial business training program itself lasts approximately three business days.
initial_training.location: Denver, Colorado metropolitan area, or another location designated by the franchisor, or via video conference.
initial_training.required_attendees: You or your Franchise Manager, and your Office Manager, plus up to two other individuals designated by you (for a total of four individuals). You or your Franchise Manager, and your Office Manager, must successfully complete the initial business training program.
initial_training.trainer_qualifications: Supervised by the President, Chris Bue, who has over 11 years of experience with the franchisor and more than 25 years of experience in the field across multiple industries. Each instructor has demonstrated satisfactory knowledge of the topics and is overseen and reviewed by Mr. Bue.

types: other additional or refresher training programs
ongoing_training.description: Regular communications on current best practices are provided. Annual conferences are held. Additional training programs may be conducted at a designated location or virtually. Mandatory seminars, programs, or meetings may be conducted, not lasting more than three days at a time. Attendance at one regional meeting and the annual national convention is required each year. Up to one additional mandatory convention or meeting every 24 months may be required.

field_support.visit_frequency: Within the first 90 days of operation
field_support.description: Within the first 90 days of operation, 18 to 24 hours of on-site training will be provided at the Business Location. This may be divided into two separate sessions. A field support TEAM member is assigned to assist with startup list completion during pre-opening.

technology_systems.ongoing_tech_support: The franchisor provides access to scheduling software and all upgrades. They also provide an e-mail account and an Internet site for prospective customers. A monthly Software and Internet Fee of $599 covers these services.

support_training.advertising_support: The franchisor provides access to marketing programs, advertising designs, advertising campaigns, and camera-ready artwork. They may charge for these materials. A suggested marketing plan, marketing materials, advertising designs, advertising campaigns, camera-ready artwork, and budgeting templates are provided at initial training. A National Brand Fund is established, to which franchisees pay 2 percent of Gross Revenues. This fund is used for advertising, promotion, and marketing of goods and services. The franchisor may use outside advertising and marketing agencies. They may require franchisees to join a Local Advertising Group. Franchisees must submit promotional and advertising materials for prior written approval.
support_training.conferences_conventions: Annual conferences are held to discuss sales techniques, new product developments, new service suggestions, accounting, inventory control, performance standards, advertising programs, merchandising procedures, and other relevant topics. Attendance may be required. Mandatory seminars, national or regional conventions, continuing development programs, other additional or refresher training programs, or other meetings may be conducted. Mandatory attendance is required for some events.

1.description: Provides handyman, repair, and maintenance services, and sales to residential and commercial customers. Services include carpentry, plumbing, electrical, drywall, painting, flooring, landscaping, and other miscellaneous repairs.
1.business_experience: We are a Colorado corporation that was incorporated on August 22, 2000 under the name Handyman Matters Franchise Corporation. On September 5, 2019, Handyman Matters, Inc., which was our former direct parent company, was acquired by Ace Services Holdings LLC (“Ace Services”), a wholly-owned subsidiary of Ace Hardware Corporation, our ultimate parent company. We changed our name to Ace Handyman Franchising, Inc. on September 18, 2019. We do business under our corporate name and under the name and service mark: ACE HANDYMAN SERVICES. We are a franchising company that sells and grants franchises for the operation of businesses (an “AHS Business”) using the name “ACE HANDYMAN SERVICES.” We have been offering franchised businesses similar to an AHS Businesses since February 2001.

7.assumptions_stated: The Initial Franchise Fee increases by $1.00 for each additional household in your Territory over 70,000 households. The high end represents the Initial Franchise Fee for the maximum territory size of 100,000. There may be a discount available. The initial training program is tuition-free for up to four people, but trainees' expenses (lodging, meals, transportation, wages) are paid by the franchisee. A commercial lease normally requires payment of the first month’s rent, a security deposit and a rent deposit equal to one month’s rent. Lease deposits vary widely. Furnishings costs may include purchasing a desk, office chair, file cabinets, decorations, and other office items. Tools and equipment estimate assumes you may already own necessary tools; otherwise, purchase is required. Truck or Van is not required until three fulltime craftsmen are employed, but can be acquired earlier. Computer Hardware and Office Equipment includes a computer and software meeting minimum specifications, workstation, laser printer, fax software, hub-router, network, wiring, and a smart phone or approved device. Software and Internet Fees cover scheduling software, e-mail, location website, and online marketing services for the first three months. Initial Marketing Spend includes collateral marketing materials and a Grand Opening event. Licenses and permits estimate includes costs for LRRP Certification and associated training. Insurance requirements are detailed, including specific coverage types and limits. Additional Funds estimate covers operating expenses for three months, including an Office Manager's salary ($24-$30/hour for 40 hours/week for 12 weeks). The estimated initial investment assumes acquisition of one AHS Business with a Territory of up to 100,000 households. Estimates are based on over 75 years of combined experience in the handyman service business. No payments to the franchisor are refundable; payments to third parties may or may not be refundable.

vehicle_requirements.ratio: Purchase or lease one vehicle for every three craftsmen employed working an average of 30 hours per week or more.

additional_vehicles.approval: All vans and trucks used must be approved by franchisor.

Franchisor's right to grant licenses for other franchise or license systems.
Franchisor's right to open, operate, sell, manage and/or franchise AHS Businesses outside the Territory.

Franchisor is not restricted from pursuing any other business concept or distributing proprietary equipment and supplies to wholesalers or other distribution outlets (other than AHS Businesses) or by Internet, catalog, mail order, telemarketing, other direct marketing sales or otherwise, whether inside or outside the Territory.

Franchisor may use its Marks and Ace Handyman Services System in connection with the provision of other services and products or in alternative channels of distribution (including by Internet, catalog, mail order, telemarketing or other direct marketing sales), inside or outside of the Territory.

Franchisor's affiliate may operate HVAC businesses, which may solicit and accept orders in the franchisee's Territory.

Franchisor can develop, acquire or be acquired by, or engage in any other transaction with other businesses, companies and/or units (competitive or not), that are or will be located anywhere, including arrangements where other units are (or are not) converted to the Ace Handyman Services System or other format, or in which company-owned, franchised or other businesses (including your AHS Business) are (or are not) converted to another format (whether competitive or not), or both, and is maintained as the same concept, as a new concept, or as a separate concept in your protected Territory.

12.franchisor_reserved_rights: The franchisor retains the right to operate or permit another AHS Business to operate within the Territory if the franchisee is in default. The franchisor also retains the right to develop and establish other franchise systems, grant licenses for these systems, open and operate AHS Businesses outside the Territory, and engage in any other business concept. The franchisor and its affiliates may use their Marks and System in alternative channels of distribution, including online sales, inside or outside the Territory. Affiliated businesses (Ace Hardware Painting Services, Ace Hardware Plumbing Services, HVAC businesses) may solicit and accept orders within the franchisee's Territory. The franchisor can engage in various business transactions, including conversions of businesses, within the franchisee's protected Territory.

15.title: Obligation to Participate in the Actual Operation of the Franchise Business

franchisee_responsibilities.details: An individual franchisee or a designated and approved Franchise Manager must directly supervise the daily operation of the franchise at the Business Location. If the franchisor believes the franchisee lacks business experience, a Franchise Manager will be required.

The Franchise Manager must be approved by the franchisor and perform direct, on-site supervision. A Franchise Manager is not required to have an ownership interest in a business entity franchisee. The Franchise Manager must attend and complete the initial business training program and abide by the Franchise Agreement and Operations Manual.

The franchisee is responsible for recruiting, appointing, hiring, firing, and supervising employees, independent agents, Office Managers, Franchise Managers, and other representatives. The franchisee has sole authority and control over day-to-day operations and employee training.

The franchisee has sole authority and control over the decision to use independent contractors. The franchisor recommends that independent contractors do not exceed 40 percent of the work force. The franchisee is solely responsible and liable for decisions regarding independent contractors and compliance with related laws and regulations.

The franchisee must conduct background checks on all employees, contractors, and subcontractors utilized in the AHS Business and System. These checks must comply with all applicable laws, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act and state equivalents. No person without a successfully completed background check should enter a customer's home or business.

An experienced Office Manager must be hired to assist with phone answering, job scheduling, employment applications, paperwork check-in, and other customer service and office duties. The Office Manager must complete the initial business training program and on-site training program.

At least one representative of the AHS Business must maintain LRRP Certification at all times. The franchisor recommends the franchisee or Franchise Manager obtain this certification. If the certified representative leaves or their certification is terminated, another representative must immediately obtain it.

The franchisee or Franchise Manager is required to devote full time and best efforts on a daily basis, in person, to the supervision and conduct of the AHS Business, not less than 40 hours per week. An exception may be made for franchisees operating multiple AHS Businesses in adjacent territories, allowing one Franchise Manager to dedicate full time to all businesses.
Prior approval from the franchisor is required to operate another business, including any e-commerce business.

franchisee_responsibilities.point: Guaranty and Assumption of Franchisee's Obligations
franchisee_responsibilities.details: Unless waived, individuals owning an interest in the franchisee entity will sign a Guaranty and Assumption of Franchisee’s Obligations, agreeing to discharge all franchisee obligations and comply with all restrictions.

franchisor_role.advice_and_training: The franchisor may provide advice, suggestions, and certain training programs to protect its brand and Marks, but this does not constitute control over the day-to-day operation of the AHS Business. The franchisor is not a joint employer.

metrics.explanation: Item 19 provides detailed financial performance data for calendar year 2024, including total revenue, gross profit, and owner discretionary income across multiple quartiles for both single and multi-territory reporting groups. It specifies the number of outlets analyzed (286) and includes notes on the data's nature and limitations.
metrics.formula_used: Full Item 19 with detailed data = 90 points

metrics.explanation: Item 7 provides a comprehensive breakdown of the initial investment for both Standard and Mini AHS Businesses, detailing 17 cost categories with specific low and high ranges and clear assumptions. The document includes a detailed explanation of these estimates, referencing their basis in experience.

Items 5 and 6 clearly disclose the initial franchise fee, royalty fee (6%), marketing fee (2%), and technology fees ($599/month). Other fees are listed with amounts and calculation methods, though some conditions for certain fees could be more explicit.

The system shows healthy growth, with a net positive growth rate over the last three years. In 2024, 35 units opened and 15 closed, resulting in a net growth of 20 units. The closure rate in 2024 was 3.88% (15/387), which is below the 5% threshold.
metrics.formula_used: Net growth (2024): (35-15)/372 * 100 = 5.38%. Closure rate (2024): 15/387 * 100 = 3.88%. Healthy growth = 60 points

metrics.explanation: The franchisor began offering franchises in 2001, indicating 23 years of experience in the franchising industry. This longevity suggests a well-established system and operational history.

Items 3-4 disclose 0 recent litigation case(s) filed within last 3 years or still ongoing: 0 direct franchisor, 0 affiliate. (3 older case(s) not scored). No recent or ongoing cases found. Clean record = 42 points.
metrics.formula_used: 1-2 cases, settled favorably = 38-40 points. Applied 38 points due to 3 cases, with 2 involving parent company.

metrics.explanation: The training program includes approximately 10-12 weeks of pre-training work and study, followed by a 3-day initial business training program (20-29 hours). It covers 11 topics, is available in Denver or via video conference, and requires attendance for key personnel. Ongoing training is available through various methods.

Support includes 18-24 hours of on-site training within the first 90 days, a dedicated field support team member for startup assistance, a support hotline via phone, text, and email during business hours, and access to scheduling software, an internet site, and an intranet site. The operations manual is provided electronically.

A protected territory is defined by zip codes, with exclusivity provided as long as the franchisee is not in default. However, the franchisor reserves significant rights, including for e-commerce, online ordering, and the operation of affiliated businesses (Ace Hardware Painting Services, Plumbing Services, HVAC) that can solicit orders within the territory.

The management team includes individuals with varying levels of franchise experience. Andy Bell has 23.75 years, Chris Bue has 9.75 years, and Colette Bell has 5.75 years. Other executives have less direct franchise experience, but possess relevant industry expertise.
metrics.formula_used: Some franchise experience across management team = 30 points

metrics.explanation: Item 19 shows positive revenue performance. For single reporting territories, the top quartile average revenue is $760,107, with 39% achieving this level. Owner discretionary income shows 61% achieving the top quartile benchmark. Multi-territory groups also show strong revenue averages.

The system shows positive signals with consistent growth and a low closure rate. While specific multi-unit ownership percentages are not detailed, the overall growth and low closure rate suggest franchisee satisfaction. Transfers (12 in 2024) are moderate compared to openings.

strengths.title: Detailed Financial Transparency
strengths.description: Item 19 provides a comprehensive breakdown of revenue and owner discretionary income across quartiles for both single and multi-territory operations. Item 7 offers a detailed initial investment breakdown with clear assumptions for 17 cost categories.

strengths.title: Established Franchisor Longevity and System Growth
strengths.description: With 23 years in franchising and consistent net positive unit growth, the franchisor demonstrates a stable and expanding system. The low closure rate of 3.88% in 2024 indicates a healthy operational environment for franchisees.

strengths.title: Comprehensive Training and Operational Support
strengths.description: The franchise offers extensive initial training, including pre-training work and ongoing support, covering 11 topics. Franchisees receive significant operational assistance, including on-site visits, a support hotline, and access to essential technology systems.

considerations.title: Limited Territory Protection
considerations.description: While a protected territory is defined, the franchisor retains broad rights, including for e-commerce and online sales. Affiliated businesses like Ace Hardware Painting Services and Plumbing Services can solicit orders within the franchisee's territory, potentially impacting exclusivity.

considerations.title: Management Team Experience Variation
considerations.description: While some key executives have substantial franchise experience, others have limited direct franchise tenure. This variation in experience across the leadership team may present different levels of support and strategic guidance.

considerations.title: Litigation History
considerations.description: Three litigation cases are disclosed, although all have been settled and are not recent. Two of these cases involved the parent company, indicating a history of disputes that, while resolved, warrant consideration.

analytical_summary: ACE HANDYMAN SERVICES scores 552 out of 600, indicating a franchise opportunity. The system demonstrates financial transparency with detailed Item 19 data and clear investment breakdowns, alongside robust franchisor longevity and system growth with a low closure rate. Franchisees benefit from training and operational support. However, considerations include limited territory protection due to franchisor reserved rights and affiliated business competition, varying management team experience, and a history of settled litigation. Overall, the franchise presents a well-supported business model with a proven track record, though potential franchisees should carefully evaluate the territory exclusivity and management team dynamics.
